intro: Achyranthes frutescens, commonly known as horse radish or wild radish, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant has a taproot system with a strong, aromatic root that is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in spikes. The plant belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family.
